dt: {bc}the bluish-gray and white fur of a squirrel prized for ornamental use in medieval times

et: Middle English {it}veir{/it}, borrowed from Anglo-French {it}vair{/it}, noun derivative of {it}vair{/it} "mottled, variegated," going back to Latin {it}varius{/it} "variegated, varied" {ma}{mat|various:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: the bluish-gray and white fur of a squirrel prized for ornamental use in medieval times
